last_episode_to_air.name: Final
last_episode_to_air.overview: Emma Willis hosts as coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, LeAnn Rimes and Tom Fletcher and Danny Jones from McFly return for an epic final in which one champion will be crowned.

name: The Voice UK
overview: A vocal contest reality series featuring people with real talent and great voices. Only the very best singers make it through the the blind auditions, the decisions from the four celebrity coaches are based solely on the voices they hear - and nothing else.

seasons.name: Series 1
seasons.overview: The first series began on 24 March 2012 and ended on 2 June 2012. The show was hosted by Holly Willoughby and Reggie Yates on BBC One.

seasons.name: Series 2
seasons.overview:
The second series started on 30 March 2013. On 13 November 2012, it was confirmed that all four coaches from last year will return. The show's Blind Auditions will move to MediaCityUK in Salford, Manchester. It was also confirmed that the live show format will be tweaked for this series, which include the cutback from six live shows in the first series to only three live shows, and the pre-recorded results show has also been dropped, with the results given on the same night as the performances. On 28 February 2013, four ten-second teaser trailers were posted to the show's official website and YouTube page.

This was the final series to feature Jessie J and Danny O'Donoghue as coaches, and Holly Willoughby and Reggie Yates as hosts.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 1
episodes.overview: Hopeful artists face the blind auditions, and the four coaches give a group performance.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 2
episodes.overview: The coaches battle it out to win over the most outstanding voices for their team.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 3
episodes.overview: Holly Willoughby and Reggie Yates host the penultimate round of blind auditions.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 4
episodes.overview: Holly Willoughby and Reggie Yates host the final round of blind auditions.

episodes.name: Battles 1
episodes.overview: Holly Willoughby and Reggie Yates host the first of a two part battles stage.

episodes.name: Battles 2
episodes.overview: Holly Willoughby and Reggie Yates host as the battles stage continues.

episodes.name: Live Show 1
episodes.overview: Team Tom and Team Will take each of their artists centre stage.

episodes.name: Live Show 1 Results
episodes.overview: Sir Tom Jones and will.i.am have to say goodbye to one artist from each of their teams.

episodes.name: Live Show 2
episodes.overview: Danny O'Donoghue and Jessie J send each of their five artists into the spotlight.

episodes.name: Live Show 2 Results
episodes.overview: Danny O'Donoghue and Jessie J must say goodbye to one artist from each of their teams.

episodes.name: Live Show 3
episodes.overview: will.i.am and Sir Tom Jones send their remaining four artists into the spotlight.

episodes.name: Results Show 3
episodes.overview: Sir Tom Jones and will.i.am must say goodbye to two artists from each of their teams.

episodes.name: Live Show 4
episodes.overview: Artists from Team Danny and Team Jessie deliver solo performances.

episodes.name: Results Show 3
episodes.overview: Coaches Danny O'Donoghue and Jessie J must say goodbye to two artists from each team.

episodes.name: The Semi-Final
episodes.overview: The remaining eight contestants battle it out for a place in the final.

episodes.name: The Semi-Final Results
episodes.overview: It is the eliminations again and at stake is a place in The Voice UK live final.

episodes.name: The Final
episodes.overview: Each coach takes one artist into the final in a bid to win the public vote.

1.name: Series 1
1.overview: The first series began on 24 March 2012 and ended on 2 June 2012. The show was hosted by Holly Willoughby and Reggie Yates on BBC One.

episodes.overview: Hopeful artists face the blind auditions, and the four coaches give a group performance.

2.name: Series 2
2.overview:
The second series started on 30 March 2013. On 13 November 2012, it was confirmed that all four coaches from last year will return. The show's Blind Auditions will move to MediaCityUK in Salford, Manchester. It was also confirmed that the live show format will be tweaked for this series, which include the cutback from six live shows in the first series to only three live shows, and the pre-recorded results show has also been dropped, with the results given on the same night as the performances. On 28 February 2013, four ten-second teaser trailers were posted to the show's official website and YouTube page.

This was the final series to feature Jessie J and Danny O'Donoghue as coaches, and Holly Willoughby and Reggie Yates as hosts.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 1
episodes.overview: The singing contest returns for a fourth series as Rita Ora joins the panel.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 2
episodes.overview: The coaches assess the vocal talents of another ten hopefuls.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 3
episodes.overview: To Sir Tom's delight, this edition sees many Welsh faces behind the spinning chairs.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 4
episodes.overview: The blind auditions continue with surprises including trumpet-playing Dawn.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 5
episodes.overview: The blind auditions continue and include a celebrity chauffeur booker and an Essex rapper.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 6
episodes.overview: The judges hear from Beckenham duo the Rise, poet Lara Lee and Damian Dalton Smith.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 7
episodes.overview: The blind auditions come to an end as the coaches complete their teams.

episodes.name: Battles 1
episodes.overview: Emma and Marvin present as the coaches pair up their acts to battle it out against each other in head-to-head musical performances.

episodes.name: Battles 2
episodes.overview: In a nail-biting final battle, the remaining artists of each team take to the stage.

episodes.name: Knockout 1
episodes.overview: The coaches must choose the best three acts from their team to continue to the live shows.

episodes.name: Knockout 2
episodes.overview: The coaches must choose the best three acts from their team to continue to the live shows.

episodes.name: Live Quarter Final
episodes.overview: Featuring live performances from Olly Murs and 2014's winner Jermain Jackman.

episodes.name: Live Quarter Final Results
episodes.overview: Emma Willis and Marvin Humes reveal the results of the public vote.

episodes.name: Live Semi-Final
episodes.overview: The semi-final sees the coaches' remaining eight acts perform live in front of the nation.

episodes.name: Live Final
episodes.overview: The final four artists face the public vote in a bid to be crowned the winner.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 3
episodes.overview: Hopefils include a Dubliner with a unique voice, an eccentric rocket and a charity worker.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 7
episodes.overview: Part 7 of the Blind Auditions, in which the singers are hidden from view and are judged solely on their voice. Coaches include Ricky Wilson, will.i.am, Boy George and Paloma Faith.

episodes.name: Knock Out Rounds 1
episodes.overview: The battle stages are now over, and Paloma Faith, Boy George, Will.i.am and Ricky Wilson each now have a complete team of would-be stars under their tutelage. The next challenge the contestants face is the first stage of the knock-outs, in which they must carefully select and perform a 'killer song' that will elevate them above their team rivals, as the coaches whittle their eight chosen singers down to three.

episodes.name: Knock Out Rounds 2
episodes.overview: The battle stages are now over, and Paloma Faith, Boy George, Will.i.am and Ricky Wilson each now have a complete team of would-be stars under their tutelage. The next challenge the contestants face is the knock-outs, in which they must carefully select and perform a 'killer song' that will elevate them above their team rivals, as the coaches whittle their eight chosen singers down to three.

episodes.name: Live Quarter Final
episodes.overview: The first live show of the series arrives, as Paloma Faith, Boy George, Will.i.am and Ricky Wilson bring their teams to the quarter finals. Naturally, with the contest reaching its conclusion, the stakes have never been higher for the eight remaining contestants, who will need to produce barnstorming performances in order to secure a place in the semi-finals. After weeks of assessing the would-be stars from the comfort of their sofas, viewers at home now receive their first chance to voice their opinions via a public vote that will decide which act will be progressing to the contest's penultimate round.

episodes.name: Quarter Final Results
episodes.overview: Emma Willis and Marvin Humes announce the results of this week's public vote. For the first time this series, coaches Will.i.am, Paloma Faith, Ricky Wilson and Boy George have handed over control of the contest to the viewers at home, who ultimately decide which of the eight remaining contestants will be progressing through to the semi-final.

episodes.name: Live Semi Final
episodes.overview: The semi finals arrive, along with the nail-biting tension associated with another round of live performances. The remaining contestants must once master their nerves and take to the stage to determine whether the tutelage they've received at the hands of Will.i.am, Ricky Wilson, Paloma Faith and Boy George has paid off. As was the case last week, the identities of those would-be stars progressing through to the grand final will be decided by the viewers at home, who are encouraged to take part in a public vote to determine which act will leaving the contest.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 1
episodes.overview: As the auditions get under way, the singing hopefuls will have to truly command the stage if they want to get those infamous red chairs spinning.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 2
episodes.overview: Judges Jennifer Hudson, Gavin Rossdale, will.i.am and Sir Tom Jones, appraises the talents of more would-be pop icons in the blind auditions, judging the contestants vocal ability alone.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 3
episodes.overview: The contest heats up as the blind audtitions continue and coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Gavin Rossdale and Sir Tom Jones search for a superstar. There are more twists and turns as the veterans of the music industry pitch against each other to fill their teams with the finest vocal talent. Can the singing hopefuls handle the pressure and produce the performance they need in pursuit of an incredible record deal with Polydor?

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 4
episodes.overview: It is the fourth round of blind auditions, and the spaces are filling up quickly as coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Gavin Rossdale and Sir Tom Jones add more talent to their teams. As their red chairs turn for the talent, the coaches pitch against each other in order to bag the finest singers, but there could be some surprises in store as the hopefuls have the final say over which team they will join.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 5
episodes.overview: The spinning-chair singing content's Blind Audition phase continues into its fifth week, as coaches Will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Tom Jones and Gavin Rossdale hunt for the nation's next singing superstar. As ever, the auditionees are invited to perform on stage, while the all-star panellists sit with their backs to the singer, only turning their chair around to see who they have just been serenaded by if they are suitably impressed by the performer. Naturally, as the contest continues to roll on, remaining spaces on each coach's teams are running short, and competition to claim the left-over spots will be as fierce as ever.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 6
episodes.overview: Coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudsen, Sir Tom Jones, and Gavin Rossdale preside over the penultimate round of blind Auditions

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 7
episodes.overview: It is the final week of blind auditions, and the last chance for the contestants to get a place on one of the coaches' teams. Taking their positions in the infamous red chairs are coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Sir Tom Jones and Gavin Rossdale, who will be seeking out the finest vocal talent to complete their line-ups.

episodes.name: The Battles 1
episodes.overview: The talent contest moves to the battle phase, in which Sir Tom Jones, will.i.am, Gavin Rossdale and Jennifer Hudson are expected to shape their protégés into their pop icons.

episodes.name: The Battles 2
episodes.overview: The second night of battle phase, in which the singers have to impress the coaches, to remain in the contest.

episodes.name: Knockout 1
episodes.overview: It's the first of the live knockout shows on The Voice UK and tonight performing for a place in the quarter-final is Team JHud. Jennifer Hudson's six remaining acts will become three as they sing for her and fellow coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones and Gavin Rossdale. The coaches can only watch and give their opinion though as tonight it is down to the public vote and the two acts with the most votes will go through to the quarter-final leaving Jennifer to save one other act.

episodes.name: Knockout 2
episodes.overview: In the second live knockout show of The Voice UK Sir Tom Jones' Team will be singing for a place in the quarter-final. Sir Tom Jones' six remaining acts will be slashed to three as they sing for him and fellow coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson and Gavin Rossdale. Tonight it is down to the public vote and the two acts with the most votes will go through to the quarter-final leaving Sir Tom to save one other act from his team.

episodes.name: Knockout 3
episodes.overview: It is the third of the live knockout shows, and performing for a place in the quarter-final tonight are will.i.am's team. His six remaining acts will become three as they sing for him and fellow coaches Sir Tom Jones, Jennifer Hudson and Gavin Rossdale. The coaches can only watch and give their opinion as it is now down to the public to vote for their favourite act, with the two acts receiving the most votes and a third act saved by will.i.am going through to the next stage. Gavin Rossdale also performs live in the studio with his band Bush.

episodes.name: Knockout 4
episodes.overview: Emma Willis hosts the final night of live knockout rounds, and it is time for Gavin Rossdale's team to sing for a place in the quarter-final. Gavin and the other coaches - Jennifer Hudson, Sir Tom Jones and will.i.am - all take their places in the infamous red chairs, but it is now down to the public to decide who stays and who goes home. Only three acts can go through and the two acts with the highest number of public votes get a place, leaving Gavin to save one other act from his team. The three acts that make it through will be one step closer to the chance of winning a recording contract with Polydor Records. will.i.am gives a very special performance live in the studio.

episodes.name: Quarter Finals
episodes.overview: The tension mounts as the singing contest draws ever closer to its conclusion. With the arrival of the quarter-finals, the remaining stars now have the reward of a lucrative recording contract with Polydor Records within sight. However, more live performances await, and coaches Jennifer Hudson, Tom Jones, Will.i.am and Gavin Rossdale will need to help whittle down the number of would-be stars to just eight ahead of the next, penultimate round. As ever, Emma Willis is on hand to provide viewers with access to all the backstage drama and on-stage reactions as events unfold.

episodes.name: Semi Finals
episodes.overview: Emma Willis hosts as the singing competition reaches its semi-final stage, with each of the eight remaining acts hoping to cling onto their place as they are whittled down one final time. As the series nears its climax, the remaining two hopefuls in each team will need to push themselves to the limit as they perform live for public votes. Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Gavin Rossdale and Jennifer Hudson can offer their opinions, but the voting public will ultimately decide which four acts stay to perform in next weekend's grand final, sending the other four acts crashing out of the competition for good.

episodes.name: Final (1)
episodes.overview: It's the first instalment of the live Final of The Voice UK as the 4 remaining singers battle it out to win a recording contract with Polydor Records. At the end of the night 3 singers will progress forward to Sunday night's finale, when one will be crowned the winner of The Voice UK. Jennifer Hudson, Sir Tom Jones, will.i.am and Gavin Rossdale will all be on hand to give the acts as much help and encouragement as possible, but ultimately it will be the viewing public who call the shots.

episodes.name: Final (2)
episodes.overview: It's the Final of The Voice UK 2017 as one singer will be crowned winner and walk away with a massive recording contract with Polydor Records. Three singers will battle it out to convince the public that they deserve the title. Tune in for what promises to be an explosive night.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 1
episodes.overview: Emma Willis hosts the seventh series of the singing contest, which this year sees Olly Murs joining returning coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones and Jennifer Hudson on the famous spinning chairs. The search for a star kicks off, as usual, with the first in a series of rounds of blind auditions, as the panel listen to each contestant with their backs turned, ensuring that they judge the performance on the strength of vocal ability alone. Those who succeed here will progress to the Battle and Knockout phases.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 2
episodes.overview: Spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity `coaches' seek out the nation's best vocal talent. But there is a simple twist - with the four coaches selecting their teams through `blind auditions', looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 3
episodes.overview: The Blind Auditions continue in the third instalment of 'The Voice UK'. With spaces on their teams filling up, the competition is getting tougher as coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Olly Murs and Sir Tom Jones continue their quest to find the nation's best vocal talent. The acts will be hoping to secure a place on the coaches' teams and earn their chance to win a recording contract with Polydor Records.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 4
episodes.overview: Coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs return to the infamous red chairs for the fourth instalment of the Blind Auditions. Their quest is to find the next singing superstar, but can the auditioning acts give the performance of their lives, secure a chair turn and a coveted place on a coach’s team?

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 5
episodes.overview: The Blind Auditions enter their fifth week, as Will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Olly Murs and Tom Jones reassemble to assess the singing skills of more would-be stars. Emma Willis ushers the contestants on-stage where, yet again, the coaches must decide whether they would like to back each performer based on the power of their voice, rather than their appearance. Only once a coach decides to support the singer are they permitted to turn their chair around, and any of the contestants chosen could be in with a chance of securing a recording contract with Polydor.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 6
episodes.overview: It’s the penultimate week of Blind Auditions, and coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs are back in their red chairs looking for the nation’s best vocal talent. The acts will be hoping to secure a place on the coaches’s teams and earn their chance to win a recording contract with Polydor Records.

episodes.name: The Battles 3
episodes.overview: It's the third and final instalment of the Battles! Coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, SIr Tom Jones and Olly Murs return to the iconic red chairs as their acts battle head to head to keep a place on their coach's team.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 2
episodes.overview: The Blind Auditions continue in the second instalment of The Voice UK. The competition heats up as will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Olly Murs and Sir Tom Jones search for a singing superstar. There will be more twists and turns from the infamous red chairs with the coaches pitching against each other to fill their teams with the finest vocal talent. Will the singing hopefuls produce the performance they need to secure a coveted record contract with Polydor?

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 3
episodes.overview: Coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs return to the infamous red chairs for the third instalment of the Blind Auditions. Their quest is to find the next singing superstar, but can the auditioning acts give the performance of their lives, secure a chair turn and a coveted place on a coach’s team?

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 4
episodes.overview: Coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs return to the infamous red chairs for the fourth instalment of the Blind Auditions. Their quest is to find the next singing superstar, but can the auditioning acts give the performance of their lives, secure a chair turn and a coveted place on a coach’s team?

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 5
episodes.overview: As the Blind Auditions for The Voice enter their fifth week, coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs continue their search for the nation's next singing star. The acts will be hoping to secure a place on the coaches' teams and earn their chance to win a recording contract with Polydor Records.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 6
episodes.overview: It's the penultimate week of Blind Auditions and coaches will.i.am, Jennifer Hudson, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs are back in their red chairs looking for the nation's best vocal talent. The auditionees must make the coaches turn in their chairs by impressing them with their vocals and earning a coveted place on one of the coaches' teams. The acts will be singing for their chance to win a recording contract with Polydor Records.

episodes.name: Live Knockouts 1
episodes.overview: It’s the first of the Knockout shows on The Voice UK as 12 acts sing for a place in the Semi Final. The coaches are helped along in the process by some very special guests.

episodes.name: Live Knockouts 2
episodes.overview: It's the second of the Knockout shows on The Voice UK as 12 acts sing for a place in the live Semi Final.

episodes.name: Semi-Final
episodes.overview: It's the Semi-Final of The Voice Uk, where the winner of the lifeline vote is revealed and the remaining singers fight to stay in the competition.

episodes.name: Final
episodes.overview: It's the final as the four remaining singers battle it out to win a recording contract with Polydor Records. Jennifer Hudson, Sir Tom Jones, will.i.am and Olly Murs will be taking to the stage with their acts before the winner is revealed.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 1
episodes.overview: Olly Murs, Sir Tom Jones and will.i.am are joined in their iconic red chairs by Meghan Trainor as the search for a superstar begins once more. Hopeful singers fight to make the chairs turn for the chance of winning a life-changing record contract.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 2
episodes.overview: The blind auditions continue in the second instalment of The Voice. The competition heats up as will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and brand new coach Meghan Trainor search for a singing superstar.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 3
episodes.overview: Coaches will.iam, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor return to the infamous red chairs for the third instalment of the Blind Auditions for the Voice UK.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 4
episodes.overview: Superstar coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Meghan Trainor and Olly Murs return to their infamous red chairs for the fourth instalment of the Blind Auditions for The Voice UK on ITV.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 5
episodes.overview: As the Blind Auditions enter their fifth week on The Voice, coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Meghan Trainor and Olly Murs continue their search for the next singing superstar.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 6
episodes.overview: It's the penultimate week of Blind Auditions and coaches will.i.am, Olly Murs, Sir Tom Jones and Meghan Trainor are back in their red chairs looking for the nation's best vocal talent.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 7
episodes.overview: It's the final round of Blind Auditions on The Voice UK, and the remaining contestants sing for their chance to win one of the final places on the coaches' teams.

episodes.name: Battle Round 1
episodes.overview: It's the start of the Battle rounds on The Voice UK, with coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor returning to their infamous red chairs.

episodes.name: Battle Round 2
episodes.overview: It's round two of The Battles on The Voice, with coaches will.i.am, Meghan Trainor, Olly Murs and Sir Tom Jones returning to their infamous red chairs.

episodes.name: Battle Round 3
episodes.overview: Emma Willis hosts the third and final episode of the Battle rounds. Coaches Will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions go head to head and fight for their place on their coach's team. The singers that impress their coach the most remain in the competition, but those that aren't so lucky can still be stolen by another coach.

episodes.name: Knockout Round 1
episodes.overview: It's the first of the Knockout shows, in which 12 acts sing for a place in the Semi Final but the coaches can only pick one act to progress in the competition.

episodes.name: Knockout round 2
episodes.overview: Emma Willis hosts the second Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live semi-final. Coaches Will.i.am, Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor are in the red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for a place on their coach's team.

episodes.name: Semi-Final
episodes.overview: Originally due to take place earlier in the year, but put on hold because of the pandemic, Emma Willis hosts the semi-final of the spinning-chair singing contest. Celebrity coaches Will.i.am, Meghan Trainor, Olly Murs and Tom Jones all hoped their act would claim victory. Now all eyes will be on the nine remaining acts to see who goes through to the series nine final.

episodes.name: Final
episodes.overview: Emma Willis and Marvin Humes present the singing competition. The grand final sees each of the remaining four acts perform a solo number and sing an exclusive duet with their superstar coach. However, the power lies with the viewers as the artists face the public vote in a bid to be crowned winner of The Voice UK 2016.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 1
episodes.overview: There is a new coach on the panel as the blind auditions begin once more. Olly Murs, Sir Tom Jones and will.i.am are joined in the red chairs by Anne-Marie as hopeful singers fight to make the chairs turn for a chance of winning a record contract.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 2
episodes.overview: The blind auditions continue and the competition heats up as will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and new coach Anne-Marie search for a singing superstar, and the coaches pitch against each other to fill their teams with the finest vocal talent.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 3
episodes.overview: Coaches will.iam, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Anne-Marie return to the infamous red chairs for the third instalment of the Blind Auditions for the Voice UK on ITV.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 4
episodes.overview: Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Anne-Marie and Olly Murs return to their red chairs for the fourth instalment of the blind auditions. Their quest is to find the next singing star, and the auditioning acts must give the performance of their lives.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 5
episodes.overview: As the blind auditions enter their fifth week, coaches will.i.am, Anne-Marie, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs continue their search for the nation's next singing star.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 6
episodes.overview: It's the penultimate week of blind auditions and coaches will.i.am, Olly Murs, Sir Tom Jones and Anne-Marie are back in their red chairs looking for the nation's best vocal talent.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 7
episodes.overview: It's the final round of Blind Auditions on The Voice UK and the remaining contestants sing for their chance to win one of the final places on the coaches' teams.

episodes.name: Battle Rounds 1
episodes.overview: It's the start of the battle rounds, with coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Anne-Marie returning to their red chairs as their acts go head-to-head and fight for a place in the semi-finals.

episodes.name: Battle Rounds 2
episodes.overview: It's Round 2 of the battles as coaches will.i.am, Anne-Marie, Olly Murs and Sir Tom Jones return to the infamous red chairs as their acts go head-to-head and fight for a place in the semi-finals.

episodes.name: Semi-Final 1
episodes.overview: It's the first of the semi-final shows on The Voice UK as 12 acts sing for a place in the final.

episodes.name: Semi-Final 2
episodes.overview: It's the second part of the Semi-final shows as 12 acts sing for a place in the final. Coaches Anne-Marie, will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs can pick only one act from their teams to progress in the competition.

episodes.name: Final
episodes.overview: It's the final of The Voice UK and the four remaining singers must battle it out to win a recording contract. Join the superstar coaches, Sir Tom Jones, Anne-Marie, Olly Murs and will.i.am, to find out who will be crowned the winner of The Voice UK.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 1
episodes.overview: Emma Willis hosts the return of the spinning-chair singing contest, with Anne-Marie Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Will.i.am on the coaching panel once again. In the opening edition the four mentors will be selecting their teams through blind auditions, where looks play no part in the selection process and each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 2
episodes.overview: The Blind Auditions continue, with more twists and turns from the infamous red chairs as the coaches pitch against each other to pick the finest vocal talent for their teams.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 3
episodes.overview: Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Anne-Marie return to the red chairs for the third instalment of the Blind Auditions.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 4
episodes.overview: Superstar coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Anne-Marie and Olly Murs return to their infamous red chairs for the Blind Auditions of The Voice UK. Can the auditioning singers give the performance of their lives and win a place on a coach's team?

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 5
episodes.overview: In the fifth instalment of the Blind Auditions, coaches will.i.am, Anne-Marie, Sir Tom Jones and Olly Murs continue the hunt for the nation’s next vocal star.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 6
episodes.overview: will.i.am, Olly Murs, Sir Tom Jones and Anne-Marie are still looking for the nation’s best vocal talent - with spaces on the teams filling up, can anyone get the chairs turning?

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 7 & Callbacks
episodes.overview: The Blind Auditions come to an end and the ten acts on each team must go through the Callbacks, a brand-new round with guest mentors including David Guetta, MNEK, and Tom Grennan.

episodes.name: Semi-Final
episodes.overview: It’s the semi-final of The Voice UK 2022 - coaches Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs, Anne-Marie and will.i.am can pick only one act from their teams of three to progress to the final.

episodes.name: Final
episodes.overview: It's the final of The Voice UK 2022, and the four remaining singers must battle it out to win a record contract - join our superstar coaches Sir Tom Jones, Anne-Marie, Olly Murs and will.i.am to find out who will be crowned as this series' winner.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions 1
episodes.overview: Emma Willis returns to host the reality talent show where unsigned singers compete to win a recording contract, a huge cash prize, and an all-inclusive luxury five-star holiday to Mauritius.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions (1)
episodes.overview: Emma Willis returns as the host of the reality singing talent show as will.i.am and Sir Tom Jones are joined by new coaches LeAnn Rimes and Tom Fletcher and Danny Jones from McFly.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions (2)
episodes.overview: Emma Willis hosts as the coaches return for the third round of Blind Auditions.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions (3)
episodes.overview: Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, LeAnn Rimes and coach duo Tom Fletcher and Danny Jones from McFly return to select more singers from the third round of Blind Auditions.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions (4)
episodes.overview: Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, LeAnn Rimes and coach duo Tom Fletcher and Danny Jones from McFly return to select more singers from the fourth round of Blind Auditions.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions (5)
episodes.overview: Coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, LeAnn Rimes and coach duo Tom Fletcher and Danny Jones from McFly return to select more singers from the fifth round of Blind Auditions.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions (6)
episodes.overview: Emma Willis hosts the singing contest, with Tom Jones, Will.i.am, LeAnn Rimes and Tom Fletcher and Danny Jones continuing to select their teams in the sixth round of blind auditions, pushing their buttons to pick the most exciting singing talent that the UK has to offer.

episodes.name: Blind Auditions (7) & Callbacks
episodes.overview: As the Blind Auditions come to an end, coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Leann Rimes and Tom and Danny from McFly must take their teams through the Callbacks, the toughest round of the competition, and are joined by superstar guest mentors Hannah Waddingham, Perrie Edwards and Griff.

episodes.name: Semi-Final
episodes.overview: Emma Willis returns to host the semi-final as coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, LeAnn Rimes and Tom and Danny from McFly must take one of their three remaining acts to the final.

episodes.name: Final
episodes.overview: Emma Willis hosts as coaches will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, LeAnn Rimes and Tom Fletcher and Danny Jones from McFly return for an epic final in which one champion will be crowned.
